12.7 DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS. In case of any dispute between the parties relating to this Agreement, such dispute shall be finally resolved in Denver, Colorado (USA) by arbitration under the Commercial Rules of Arbitration of the American Arbitration Association, using three arbitrators, one selected by each of McDATA and Reseller and the third selected in accordance with such Rules. The
arbitrators will decide the issues presented to them applying the substantive laws of the Sate of Colorado (USA). The award of the arbitrators may be granted notwithstanding the absence of any party and such award shall be in writing and shall be final and binding upon the parties and shall not be appealed from or contested in any court or tribunal. Any award rendered hereunder may be entered for enforcement, if necessary, in any court of competent jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.7 DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS. In case of any dispute between the parties relating to this Agreement, such dispute shall be resolved by methods that the parties agree to. The parties acknowledge and agree that should they pursue arbitration as a method of dispute resolution, the final decision of the arbitrator(s) may be appealed in any court of competent jurisdiction.
perturbation.explanation: This change alters the dispute resolution clause by removing the mandatory arbitration in Denver, Colorado and replaces it with a mutual agreement process. The clause about being final and binding has been deleted and replaces with a section stating the arbitration award may be appealed, thus undermining the purpose of arbitration to be final and binding.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Arbitration Act (FAA), Colorado Revised Statutes regarding arbitration

perturbation.changed_text:
10.4 THE WARRANTIES, IF ANY, PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT (INCLUDING THE APPENDICES AND CHANNEL NOTIFICATION DOCUMENTS) OR AS PROVIDED WITH THE PRODUCTS ARE GIVEN IN LIEU OF ALL OTHER
WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, NONINFRINGEMENT OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. All warranties are hereby expressly granted and included.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by initially stating that all warranties are disclaimed and excluded, then immediately stating that all warranties are expressly granted and included. This creates ambiguity and makes it difficult to determine the actual warranty terms, potentially misleading the Reseller.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty of Merchantability, Implied Warranty of Fitness for a Particular Purpose

perturbation.original_text: 12.11 COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS. McDATA and Reseller each agree to comply with all applicable laws and each understand and agree that the continuing rights and obligations of the parties hereunder are specifically conditioned upon compliance with such laws. These laws include, without limitation, the following: (i) the U.S. anti-boycott regulations, (ii) the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act ("FCPA"), (iii) the export control laws of the United States of America, (iv) the prevailing regulations which may be issued from time to time by the U.S. Department of Commerce and the Office of Munitions Control and the U.S. Department of State, and (v) any export or import laws of the agencies of the Territory or of any countries into or through which the Products purchased under this Agreement may be transported.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.11 COMPLIANCE WITH LAWS. McDATA and Reseller each agree to comply with all applicable laws, but only to the extent such compliance benefits McDATA, and each understand and agree that the continuing rights and obligations of the parties hereunder are specifically conditioned upon compliance with such laws. These laws include, without limitation, the following: (i) the U.S. anti-boycott regulations, (ii) the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act ("FCPA"), (iii) the export control laws of the United States of America, (iv) the prevailing regulations which may be issued from time to time by the U.S. Department of Commerce and the Office of Munitions Control and the U.S. Department of State, and (v) any export or import laws of the agencies of the Territory or of any countries into or through which the Products purchased under this Agreement may be transported.
perturbation.explanation: This edit introduces a contradiction that may lead to legal issues. It now says the parties will comply with applicable laws only to the extent such compliance benefits McDATA. This creates an ambiguous condition where compliance depends on McDATA's perception of benefit, contradicting the intended spirit and explicit purpose of compliance laws, which are typically mandatory and without regard to benefit.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Multiple federal and international laws (FCPA, Export Control Laws)
